name: Kayte Randall
text: My family and I had a most relaxing weekend celebrating my birthday.  There was something to do at all times.  We will be back!

name: Charlie Cline
text: Good location. Nice staff. Clean. Breakfast area is small. Door is hard to enter if you are carrying anything. No fridge in room. Beds are comfortable.

name: Will Storms
text:
Reserved a room with two Queens, none available at check-in.  Desk clerk was very polite and got us in a room that worked, but was not ideal.

Bathroom was outdated and needed an update, especially the shower/tub.  Faucet had to be turned just the right way to get hot water and overall appearance left a little to be desired.

Breakfast seemed like it would have been good, but it fell short.  There was a great selection, but several issues.  The cooked eggs were way over cooked and left in the heat lamps too long.  Additionally, the very cool pancake maker was out of batter.

The only thing that kept this at two stars instead of one, is the friendliness of the staff.

name: UMP
text: Owner had the room ready for our event. He was wonderful and very accommodating. Event went very well! I would recommend this hotel.

name: michael forester
text: Nice hotel. Clean rooms. Decent breakfast. Not enough parking or water pressure.  I would stay here again.

name: First name Last Name
text: Best front desk customer service from Tura and Johnmon we have experienced in a LONG time!! We had experienced a rough day, they brightened our spirits and left us in a better mood way after checkout. Special thanks to them.. other hotels should take note.

name: David Stikeleather
text:
The room was clean but I felt it was overpriced. She gave me her "best" price which was more than I've ever paid in a Holiday Inn. When I intimated I was considering leaving, she dropped another $25. Even then, had I seen the room first, I would have held out for more. My problem was I'm used to a room with microwave and frig which had neither. It had an overstuffed chair crammed between the bed and wall that didn't fit well. By the time the chair and footrest were stuffed in, to get in bed you had to start near the foot and crawl up to the top.

I suspect they don't have maintenance on site. The bathroom towel rack was loose with some of the screws sticking out and the top towel shelf looked like someone had been doing chin up's with it as it was bent down. Not so bad that the towels were falling off but almost. The bathroom didn't have an exhaust fan. That was OK if you didn't want to shave after a shower but if you did, the fog on the mirror was indeed a handicap. If you briskly moved the door back and forth, the clearing of the mirror was dramatically improved.

The desk clerk was very pleasant but if people were willing to pay her starting price, she could well afford to be pleasant.

I don't know what issues others have had with the breakfast but I felt it was as good as most if not better than other Holiday Inns. The lady taking care of it was VERY pleasant and went out of her way to see we had everything we needed.

name: Mariah Arkins
text: Wonderful room.  Breakfast service was a little poor , but the rest of the Inn was comfortable

name: G Brown
text: Horrible customer service, charged us for an extra night at a extra premium price for a basic room and after a MONTH still haven't refunded the overcharge!! I think that's call theft! Stay away from this den of liars and head to the Hampton...

name: Dana Ward
text: First room, 300, they gave us had a heater that made horrible noises. Had to argue with the front desk lady  who told me all heaters make noise. Yah, I'm from up north, heaters do not, or should not, make loud banging noises. I even showed her a recording of it. Finally agreed to move us after calling and requesting then visiting the lobby, to 322. This rooms heater makes normal quiet heater noises but I do not think had been cleaned. There was a drink in the fridge, an ez dose pill bag in the bathroom, stink bugs, and the night stand pulled about 3 ft away from wall. My daughters white socks are now a nasty brown color on the bottom from walking around the room in them. Toilet will only stop running if you lift the handle. Floor feels soft like it's not sound and hadn't been vacuumed since I saw clothing tags and garbage. We were afraid to ask for another room as it was hard to get switched to this one. It did have good wifi. I doubt I'll stay here again on my travel through. Surrounding area is nice with plenty of restaurants, shopping and other hotels.

name: Anitra Rose
text: So being a bartender I understand ABC laws but in 4 nights my ID was checked 4 different ways. Now with that being said the reason I don’t have a “valid” ID is due to me I got a DUI no one else did that to me but myself.. with that being said  in 4 separate nights my ID was not checked at all. Paper copy accepted. Paper copy accepted with old hard copy. Then completely denied and having the cops called on me with a bold faced lie.. the door guy said he scanned my ID (when in fact he did not and had no scan device outside 😂) and said I had multiple charges and was being argumentative and combative. When all I asked is why in 4 nights with the same ppl y’all couldn’t decide what they wanted to do?Luckily for me one of the police officers that was there one of the nights they accepted my ID backed me up and agreed that they should have never wasted police time for something they can’t get figured out. And to end the story and top it all off they have been holding 42$ in “pre authorized fees” for over week on a 31$ bill 😂 I’m not sure if it’s covid or what that’s got them acting anyway they want too but seriously to make up lies and hold almost 50$ after you’ve accepted an ID several times is childish. Unprofessional. And down right ridiculous...courtyard trussville ran better than this lol

name: Kirk kirkland
text: Absolutely horrible service. Rude and nasty attitudes. Been going for years. WILL NEVER GO BACK. Me and my party of three left because of the experience on 3/7/20. The bartender were disgusting.. I could not believe how they treated us.

name: Melanie Logan
text: I have never before arrived at a dark hotel with no cars in the parking lot beside the employee's that was working at the front desk.  It had a banner over the original Holiday Inn with their name on it.  We arrive in the lobby with two small dogs that we had put on our booking reservation and told it was a certain amount.  We arrive in the room that I must say had a terrible odor, carpets were stained, no shampoo, etc.  We stay because we had a lot to do while in town and didn't want to worry about finding another hotel for pets.  We get home and find an additional $50 on our account.  I called them and was told I didn't tell them about the dogs.  I guess they were blind since we had them right in front of them and #2 we put it on the booking reservation - HELLO!!!!!  We were also told that their would be a continental breakfast.  I guess since no one else was at the hotel, they didn't feel a need to provide that as well.  WILL NOT RECOMMEND THIS DUMP TO ANYONE!!!!!!

name: April Westberry
text: The staff was very nice. Since it was out of season they were not serving breakfast anymore but it still said it on the receipt. I informed the lady at the front desk in the morning and she said she would take care of it and asked me what I wanted. Turns out she went and purchased breakfast for me and my boyfriend. I thought it was over and beyond and even though at first I was a little irritated her excellent service out that to rest. The rooms were adequate. Nothing fancy but they were clean and it said they were in the process of renovation so I'm sure it will improve after thatis over.

name: Jennifer Castillo
text:
Got here and every hotel was booked but this one. Stayed for 4 nights and while the staff was very very friendly, everything else was yucky!
Carpets in room were disgusting and filthy, bathroom was never cleaned it seems, no tissues, towels are so small it would pass for a kids towel, and we saw a cockroach. Breakfast was a joke (if there was any). While we are thankful to have had a place to stay, we won’t be back. The staff was the only good thing about this place.

text: Staff is friendly and helpful. The hotel has undergone an ownership change and is currently under renovations, but we are evacuating from a hurricane, so we weren't picky. The staff is making our stay as comfortable as possible and we are grateful. I'm sure in the future, when the renovations are complete, this will be a very nice place.

name: American River Pictures
text: This place is magnificent. The beauty is everywhere, the only down side is that it is a very far drive into the country, but it's worth it. When you first drive up, you will see lush hillside and at the bottom of the hill you will see the most beautiful church you have ever seen, I had no idea we had stuff like this in America, I thought it was all in Europe. Make sure to come on a weekday if you want to go inside the castle or the John Paul ll Museum. If you come to Alabama it's a must see, if you're a believer or none believe. Oh and make sure you don't wear shorts, a dress above the knees or sleeveless shorts just like the church's in Europe they will not let you in, but unlike the churches in Europe if you forgot, they have stuff you can put over your clothes.

I'm not sure where to begin so I guess I'll start with trying to get in the room. key didn't work and it's not a card that one can just get reprogrammed it's old school key....sink was broken, guy tried to blame it on me....only was in the room for a minute doing my check in inspection....i could say more but not worth getting worked up about it. Just know there is no refunds of any sort....that should tell you enough right there.

name: Burt and Sharon Coffman
text: The positive: it's a motel where there are none & after midnight we were glad to see it. The desk clerk was very nice & the beds were clean. But...  the walls were so thin we could hear people's conversation & rap music in the next room after 1 am. The phones weren't working so we knocked on the neighboring room door several times & finally called the front desk on our cellphone to complain. The clerk did come out & bang & yell until she got a response after threatening to call the police. There was fresh paint drips everywhere. There were holes in the bedspread & burn marks on the tub. There was no shampoo or even a blow dryer. The parking lot was so flooded near the rooms my husband had to move the vehicle for me to get in without going through about 6" of water. There were live bugs crawling in the bathroom. And we were told this was a brand new room! So...  I'm being generous with 2 stars. That's for the clerk.

name: Christine Waltman
text: Was great for over night. We were here for Church fellowship meeting, they put our groups rooms beside each other an a great price. Thanks to the workers for being so nice.

name: Ira Orellana
text:
The staff was courteous, they have hot water and their a/c works lovely but my goodness we will never stay at this hotel again. Besides the old furniture, hair found on multiple pillows cases, smoke seeping into the room, THEY HAVE ROACHES! These roaches are so bad we had to sleep with all the lights on for our 3 nights stay. There was dead roaches everywhere. Drawer, under coffee pot and even smashed within the bible pages(Imagine my disgust trying to be humble and patient with this condition only to read the bible for a good word and DEAD ROACHES INSIDE). This was one of the most miserable experiences we have ever had. There is no love being put into this property. Upon addressing our concerns, they said we had their best room.
I pray this review helps another family from experiencing this and our this property goes through a major renovation.

name: Netflix Account
text: i stayed here several times.. needed to get away from home for few days. its close to all the fast food restaurants and walmart is just across the street! very convenient! Rooms and staff nice too for the price!

text: The people are nice but the place is outdated. It's in desperate need of an upgrade but other than that the price is reasonable and it is located around a lot of stores and places to eat.

text: If I could leave less than 1 star review I would. Bed bugs. Bed bugs. Bed bugs. After driving ALL day from South Carolina for my nieces funeral...... be we're greeted with bed bags after seeing a small one on the bed I pulled mattress off and slid box springs back and the bed was crawling with bugs. My sons each got 4 or 5 bites and I did too. We loaded up ALL the blankets and pillows on our bed that was from our home and left. Disgusting!!!!!

text: Stayed here June 23 2017.   Room was fine.   Bed linens very clean.   Lady at front desk was very sweet.   Would definitely stay here again.

name: Heather Wilson
text: Black curly hairs all over the bathroom and towels, Fishy smell, dirty pillow cases, nasty worn couch, worn chairs, poor ac unit, door frame rigged back up with screws... need I go on? Don't stop here... keep going up the road to the Log Cabin... if they have vacancy for $10 to $20 more, you can get a clean, hair free, fresh smelling room with a decent breakfast! $65 for this dump is quite depressing... I'm only capable because I keep imagining I'm on fear factor... can you make it 10 hours here??? Pray for me!

name: Tiffany Williamson
text: Nastiest rudest place I have ever in my life been. Cigarette holes in the comforters. Nasty floors and toilets. ROACHES EVERYWHERE. BED BUG BLOOD TRAILS AND HOLES IN THE BED BUG MATTRESS COVERS. LADY AT FRONT DESK TODAY ULTRA RUDE !!!!!! Needless to say, we took the children and did not stay. Getting the money back for the room, we were told would take a month last night, then today they are saying a week. Horrible. Do not stay especially if you have children !!! Yuck! We went to the Log Cabin Hotel place down the road. Much much better. Not perfect but a million times better and worth the little more given the cost of pest control if you take bed bugs or roaches home from woodwind. Go anywhere else, even camping would be better.

We asked for a non smoking room, that room smelled like cigs. Candy machine in office/lobby had old Hot Tamales. But i do have to say that the man and lady that woked there on the night i stayed was nice. But they do need to clean up a bit and maybe paint the rooms.

The remote didn't work for TV power or volume. The coffee pot was filthy. There were black flakes on the pillows. They smelled sour. I was so glad I brought my own pillow. The tub wasn't clean. The  sink wasn't clean and there were cobwebs over the light fixtures by the bathroom.
The one good thing was Wi-Fi. Most uncomfortable night for me. I won't stay again.

name: Arri Smith
text: Don’t waste your time. There is a lady there that has been there for a while and she has the worst attitude. No matter what you say she has an attitude whether at night or in the morning when clocking out. There phone was messed up so me and my friend didn’t get a call and when I went up there to pay for another day she told me she wasn’t going to rent to me and that I was on the do not rent list now and her and some man were both sitting there arguing with me about why I didn’t answer a phone that never ring for like 10 mins. Smh. Not worth the money.

name: Cyndi Hadley
text: Rented a room just so my 6 year old could swim in an uncrouded pool. Got to the room, ate, changed clothes and got in the pool. Was in it about an hour and left to pick up my husband. They closed the pool due to weather. 3 hours after the weather had passed, she refused to reopen the pool. Upon looking at the room, it was nasty. Trash under the bed, mirrors not clean and feces wiped on the bathroom door. When I told the girl at the desk, she kept rolling her eyes telling me she couldn't call anyone nor change my room because I had been in it a couple hours. Worse place in Bay Minette to stay!

name: James Wallace
text: Good and clean rooms and friendly staff and relaxed atmosphere

name: Kyle Whalen
text: Very good location in town close to everything important, the service has been excellent, the only thing that could improve would be the facilities themselves, furnitue b has seen better days, walls could use a fresh coat of paint etc

name: Eric Frye
text: Friendly staff, decent rooms with access to eating and shopping in close proximity to the facility.

name: Holly Phillips (Feisty)
text: After driving 7 hours or so with a 4yr old & 1 yr old to attend a funeral the next morning at 11 am. The LAST thing you want to do is to have to Get you children up at 3 am, pack back up and hunt for another room bc the one you're in has BED BUGS. We had to drive 45 minutes away to get another room it was after daylight before getting my boys in a bed. Needless to say I didn't get but about 2 hours sleep and had to make the trip back North that evening, I won't ever lay in another hotel bed without checking for bedbugs ..

name: Sandra Middleton
text: Checked-in October 2016... this place needed a through cleaning and upgrade. Furniture was cracked or pieces broken off. Got a smoking room which you could smell the cigarettes (told at office it was not noticeable but the worst for me was the mold smell.  It was overwhelming since I have an allergy to it.  My son noticed the mold but the cigarette smell got him.  We did not stay for 30 mins, packed and left.  No I did not get a refund, I had just driven from Lousiana and was dead tired and wanted to rest.  I will give it two stars cuz the ladies were very nice and friendly in office.  Otherwise very disappointed.  Had stayed here years ago and it was wonderful.

name: Jennifer Flowers
text: Friendly service, great town, great place to go!

name: Joe Kaspar
text: It's a dump, door lock broke, they couldn't repair, had to find another hotel for accommodations, they refused to discount my previous days stay regardless of the inconvenience they caused me, not to mention, this was during a hurricane evacuation!

name: Mary Ann Nichols
text: Beware of choosing to stay here. You will become prisoners of the workers that live here while renovations are being done including damage to your vehicle.

name: Brenda Ba
text: My family always stay here great people affordable.

name: wayne
text: Quiet with great rates

name: Joshua Benson
text: I've stayed in quite a few hotels. Never in my life have I woken up with over a dozen bug bites. This place has BED BUGS! Avoid it like the PLAGUE!

name: Leslie Marie
text: Beautiful with the love of my life

name: Pamela Stansell
text: NICE FOR A NIGHT,WOULD HAVE TO THINK ON IT A BIT.BEFORE STAYING LONGER

name: Bobby Warren
text: Good

name: Dalaina Chasteen
text: Loved it here!! Room was clean and the location was perfect. Staff was friendly and the room service was great! Anything you needed they got it for you. Can't beat the price either! They had construction going on, putting brand new stuff in all the rooms, laying carpet in the hallway, but it wasn't a bother. Would definitely stay here again!!

name: Tina Blankenship
text: We stayed at this hotel 2 nights, the staff was really nice, anything we needed they were happy to help. The room was clean but the shower curtain was torn and the sheets were stained. The floor in the room was wood so it was clean but the hallway carpet was dirty. There is no arcade but the pool room is nice. Breakfast was also really good. There is cereal, bagels, waffles, different breads, and milk, coffee, and juice. The juice is not good at all but the rest of it was great.

name: Tammy Helton
text: Room was clean.  Fresh paint.  New furniture.  New linens and mattresses.  Service was great.  I would stay again.

name: Ashley Peters
text: Amazing hotel all around! Clean rooms, very nice staff, and great location! Will be coming back every chance we get! God Bless!

name: Katie Beecham
text: Do not, for the love of God, stay at this hotel. Spend your money where you'll be taken care of. Booked online for two queen beds, as my boyfriend, sister and I were on vacation. Got there, only had a queen bed and no other rooms. They said the next night they would give us a different room. I asked management about a different room, they only had a room with a hard key that management would have to unlock for us every time we needed back in the room. We declined because of the inconvenience. Upon check out, I asked if they would discount the room since they messed up our reservations. They did nothing to correct the issue. I will NEVER stay at this hotel chain again. Also, it smells very bad and feels very dirty. I don't recommend walking around barefoot.

name: Brittany Turner
text: DO NOT STAY HERE!!! I understand it's a cheap hotel near the beach, but it is worth spending the extra money to stay somewhere CLEAN!!! The room was filthy! We did not have a fridge or microwave. There were no towels and when I asked for more I was blatantly told there weren't any and wouldn't be for a while. This happened both nights of my stay and the staff was very unapologetic. Also, upon checkout, the girl working the front desk was very rude. I didn't expect a five star stay, but a clean room with towels is the bare minimum.

name: Shannon Simon
text: Magnuson has purchased a hotel that was formally a Days Inn. When it was a Days Inn this hotel was awesome... Now it is run down!! The tub and bed had hair everywhere. The hot tub and sauna is out of order. Breakfast is toast and corn flakes. The customer service was horrible. They overcharged me for a room and gave me a hard time about getting a partial refund. I will not return.

name: Kari Matadobra
text: I heard that they are getting better, and I sincerely hope they clean the place up. My husband and I came here and then left to a different hotel in April 2016 at 8 pm at night. I very much hope that they shampoo the carpets and clean the elevators and replace the shower curtains and leave cleaning materials in the room for people to use. We were just so worried about the cleanliness of the bed, and the weird feel of the room, that we couldn't stay.

name: valera miller
text: BED BUGS..BED BUGS..BED BUGS!!!WE WERE THERE FOR A WEDDING ON MAY 30, 2015. THAT BED BUG MOTEL LOCATED AT 3049 WEST 1ST STREET SHOULD BE CLOSED DOWN PERMANENTLY AND CITED BY THE CITY AS UNINHABITABLE!!THE ROOMS WERE NASTY..LOCKS ON DOORS WERE BROKEN..YES BROKEN!!! AND ALL THE LINEN AND BEDDING SHOULD BE BURNED AND DISCARDED!!AND LAST BUT NOT LEAST, THE CLERK AT THE FRONT DESK SHOULD BE FIRED!!HER ATTITUDE WAS RUDE AND UNPROFESSIONAL FOR ANY TYPE OF PROFESSIONAL BUSINESS LOCATED IN AMERICA!!!!.AND THEY HAD THE NERVE TO STILL HAVE THE OLD TRAVEL LODGE SIGN POSTED OUT FRONT TO GIVE YOU THAT FALSE SENSE OF SECURITY!!THE ONLY REASON WE STAYED AT THAT BATES HORROR MOTEL WAS BECAUSE ALL THE OTHER HOTELS WERE FULL DUE TO THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND UPON OUR ARRIVAL!!!!PLEASE THINK TWICE ABOUT THIS PLACE!!SLEEP IN YOUR CAR IF YOU MUST!!..WE HAVE THE PICS AND BED BUG VIDEO TO PROVE IT!!PLEASE RUN🏃🏃🏃

name: Patrick Kiessel
text: This place is a dump. Too many negatives to list here. The only positive is that it doesn't leak when it rains. It's cheap for a reason. I suggest spending a little more and staying somewhere else.

name: Carol Velez
text: After reading all the negativity reviews of this hotel, I was scared to actually stay there.  However, I got a great deal for 4 nights and considering I was limited on cash, I decided to stay there.  The room we stayed in was not bad at all.  They are remodeling and I do think we had one of the remodeled rooms.  The room was very clean.  The shower looked brand new.  The toilet flushed and shower drained very well.  The only negative remarks I have about the room is the fresh odor of paint gave me headaches and the remote control.... The t.v. remote control did not work.  I went to the front desk and they gave me another one.  That one didn't work either.  They told me they will have to reprogram the remotes, which they never did.  That didn't matter that much because we weren't watching much television anyways.  Staff was nice.  I asked for extra towels and they gave me more.  Extra roll of toilet paper was in the bathrooms.

name: Carol Stephens
text:
WARNING. Employee Stole my credit card number and charged $63.05 for pizza on it.
We stayed at the Magnuson Inn 213 W Fort Morgan Road Gulf Shores,Al.
on September 19,20 &21 2016. We have stayed there several times with no problems. However the property has been sold since our last visit and different people work there now. Until I found about the theft (when I got home) everything was fine .The staff was friendly, the price was right and I could bring my 2 small dogs.
If you decide to stay there pay with CASH! Then you won't have to go through
what I am at the bank. New cards etc.

name: Anita Bible
text:
This is really a Day's Inn Hotel.  I'm not sure why they are calling it Magnuson.  Our stay was 6/26/2014
We were told check in time was 3 over the phone and no early check in.  When we got there at 3 we were told "check in time is 4" Not cool!  They did let us in our room though when I ask for a manager and told her I had called an hour before we arrived and was told "check in time was 3"

If you think your getting a continental breakfast, it's pathetic!  Here is what you get: two types of cereal (corn flakes and generic cheerios) bread white and wheat for toast.  Packages of oatmeal to make your own, what say's orange juice (I doubt if it is even has 10% because it taste like coolaid not juice) and coffee with packages of non dairy powdered creamer and sugar or sweet and low.  That's it, no fruit, pastries only what is listed above.  I told the manager that was the most pathetic continental breakfast I have ever seen and she just walked away.  For 159 per night, I would expect more than this!
Beds were very comfortable on a good note.

name: Inda Hooper
text:
Please don't waste your money at this place!!!!! It was dirty scared to walk around with no shoes on. The
shower had hair all in the tub and tub walls. Had to go to the front office to
get more toilet paper. Asked for two rolls and the lady at front desk said we didn't need two rolls. Rude! Had to go to the front to get towels too and the sa

name: Morgan Barnes
text: This was the most disgusting hotel and the worst staff I have ever met. We found drugs in our room left from one of the cleaning employees or the last person who stayed in that particular room. They obviously did not bother to clean the room due to the drugs being left in the open. They then acted like it was no big deal and kept telling me they would contact me about the issue but I have not heard back from them and the manager did not document the issue either. The room was filthy and outrageously priced. We were one of the three other guest that checked-in within the same time frame and all had complaints about the filthiness of the room that "just got done cleaning."

name: Charles Gann
text: This is a negative Rating Does not deserve a star! This is the Worst hotel Ever!!!!!!! First we couldn't check in until almost 5 pm because our rooms were not ready, even though we booked a month in advance. Then, the room was nasty. The air barely worked. They only let you have 2 towels per room and will only give you towels if you turn in the dirty ones. So basically you turn in the dirty ones in the morning to get two clean ones at about 5 pm. The ladies at the front desk could care less about the customers and they show it with their attitudes. The ice machine was broken. The elevator got stuck with my kids in it. Doors Do Not shut, you have to pick the door up!!! We stayed 5 days and maid service Never came into our rooms! What a joke. Now our c/c is being charged because someone at the hotel stole our card number and started using it down there. And yes we called the police and there was already an ongoing investigation!!! Called the hotel about the charges and they said it was a pet deposit!! I didn't have any pets, Do not waste your money or time and Priceline shouldn't list this place on their website!

name: Serena Mason
text: We thought it was a fairly decent look hotel, but once we checked in there was a bad faucet in the tub. The second room had no tv control, and the bathroom door wouldn't latch. Then the next day we had no power or water, understandable for a short time because of a busted pipe. The power finally came back on but the water was off untill late that night. Any organized business would discount for that sort of stuff so that people would return.

name: Ashley Whitaker
text: The staff were friendly,  and the rooms were very clean.  Great place to stay.

name: Justin Goodman
text: Nothing good to say about it. When we got there the girl at the front desk had no prior training. They just stuck her in there on Christmas day not knowing what to do. She didn't even know how to put paper in the printer.  After we paid with our credit card and got the room key we noticed a sign on the elevator that said elevator may get stuck....!!! We get to the room and it's so stuffy from no air circulation. ..it stunk! The air conditioner was missing all of its parts and would not even come on! The toilet had the last guests skid marks...lol...and there were dead roaches all in the floor! Went to get a refund and the girl at the front desk didn't know how to refund our money so she had to call another woman and she said it would be 2 hours before she would be there to refund our money. I was fuming! And on top of it all the parking lot was dark and scary....thought our vehicle would get broken into and while we were waiting on our refund a old man brings in a pair of hooker boots he found in the parking lot! Omg.....never again!  Poor management.....

name: LaSheena Revel
text:
Tonight is our first stay,so I'll pray to God it's all right for one night...

Unfortunately I booked with a whole nother hotel with a credit card and get there and they have no rooms available !
Pissed off

So were stuck with this one :/

name: slabbaby81 Buchanan
text: I recommend not to stay here..stayed 3 weeks and room was cleaned maybe three times!!

name: Jeremy Gossett
text: Newly renovated, better than I expected.  Now a Quality Inn.  Google still thinks it is Magnuson Inn or Gulf Shores Inn. Booked Gulf Shores Inn, Notified by Manguson... checked into Quality Inn.

name: Marina gardner
text:
We arrived around 4 when we were told we could check in. I had reserved the room a week in advance. Our room was ready but the people ahead of us wasn't.
There were 2 towels in the room after I stated there were 4 people. Went to get more and they said they were out. Desk attendant actually went to and empty room and got towels.
The people employed here do not care that the place is a mess. They aren't friendly. There are no smiling faces. Nothing. Thank goodness there is a Walgreens in front for simple things like soap. We brought our own but in case you didn't don't rely on the hotel.
The bed was comfortable.  The air worked good and there's a tv in there.
I understand you get what you pay for but I paid $140 a night and got crappy service. No towels. Bathroom shower had no pressure. Tub and toilet were stained.
We didn't see the continental breakfast because we brought our own food but from the other reviews I didn't miss anything.
If you don't mind all that it's only 5 min from the beach and was cheaper than other places further from beach

name: morgan kimball
text: The hotel is great. Very clean and decent continental breakfast. I wish they had an outdoor pool as there is only and indoor pool and there is no faucet for the bathtub only a shower head but other than than a good stay.

name: Dee Lewis
text: It should have came with a microwave for $130 plus tax a night. Housekeeping didn't change the pillowcases after our first night. We could tell because dye from someone's hair was still there. Everyone was staring as if they wasn't use to my culture . There were only 2 towels for 4 people. It just felt secretly dirty from the time I walked in, but everything else by the beach was booked.

name: Eric Jerkins
text: Great service and prices

name: Jessica Godfrey
text: Its not the best hotel but it's also not $200 a night my room was clean and smelt nice and love the fact that they have an indoor pool I will definitely  be back

name: shanda pressley
text: Oh my gosh! If there was a negative 2! We just prayed we made it through the night. Looks ok from outside. But the plug ins....forget about it only 2 would hold  our phone chargers. The toilet omg wouldnt flush, we had to get water in a trash can pour it in the back of toilet. The curtains didn't match the 2 bed spreads, neither did the 2 bed spreads. The remote was held together by ducktape! Hardly no channels. The lights either didn't work or they came on by themselves! For real while our son in law was brushing his teeth the light flipped on! We slept on top of the covers. Don't go in the bathroom unless someone else is in the room! It sometimes won't open! You will have to be let out! Bring bedroom shoes or flip flops thE carpet will make your feet dirty!! The walls are a mess! Patched up, not painted. The bathroom door is coming apart literally. Had we not been so tired and already paid we would have asked for our money back and fussed that guy out for having a crappy ass hotel!!!! Trust us "it ain't worth it!"

name: Angela Inman
text:
Well..besides not very pleasant service and lack of service they have ROACHES. They need to shut down and bomb and fog the place.. nasty i hope i have everything checked good so i dont see one at home!! And really hope my card number doesnt try get used like someone else. But i did watch them they didnt get back of my card info. Then they didnt write the correct address in my papers but said it was okay.. ?? I feel it could be a great place with smiles and better attitudes toward the place.
Ill pay more for somewhere else next time!

name: Claudia Fox
text: Excellent housekeeping, even though we got sand everywhere

name: Paula Doucet
text: reservation for king size bed with handicapped accessibility.  tried to give us room with double bed and no handicap access.  and charge the same rate.  wasnt a magnuson, it was a travelodge.

name: Tonya Early
text: 18th anniversary 😥 No Towels! Room Not Clean, we didn't get room we reserved. Dirty coffee pot, clogged kitchen sink I was given Poo covered plunger to plunge it with.. No sink soap, no kleenex,  fridge was dirty, no blankets, hot tub broke , pool turned off, ice machine broke,  breakfast was stale cereal or instant grits.  Cable tv would not work clear  it was staticky bad 😡😡

name: Jennifer Walker
text: Upon arrival the guest clerk was no where to be found...husband waited 10 mins before anyone came out??RED flag 1... Finally she came back and was having issues finding our names in her computer system...I had booked online w/ccard she showed no record of it?? She became more irritated the more she kept looking and could not find anything.  She's griping and complaining about this and that and why they can't just do it this way and that?? Okay we end up just paying for the night...got our keys and headed to the room.  There was a black guy in there cleaning?? Red flag 2 Ok so she proceeds to go in and get on her knees wiping up the floor in the bathroom?? WTHeck?? Red flag 3  Ok so we go in and she promises to bring some fresh towels. We didn't even notice she gave us a room w/ 2 queen beds we had booked for a king bed. It was hot in the room so we checked ac and it was iced up. Umm needed to pee so go to the bathroom and there is mildew all over the dang shower curtain?? No light fixture in the bathroom.  Filthy is all I can say. I turned back the linens and noticed stains on the sheets. Needless to say we did not stay the night.  I can promise you this is an owner problem!! No sense of ability to manage money. He needs help w/this hotel.. It needs lots of maintenance.  Please spend your money somewhere else.

name: Doris Black
text: It couldve been cleaner but its so close to the beach i didnt care. Quiet at night.

name: Terry Coburn
text: Where do I start?  TV doesn't work, temperature of shower water could not be regulated, and pool was dirty.  In general not a well kept hotel.

name: Matt Murphy
text: Awful. Had to wait four hours to get a room we booked two months before then they gave us the wrong room three times. When we finaly got our room it had not even been clean and the ac bearly worked!!! Will never stay again

name: Angelia Ezell
text: Worst hotel ever!! first of all had trouble finding it The sing says the name is Travel Lodge not Magnuson !! Rooms were dirty, paint chipping off walls, smoke detector missing and the bare wires hanging out of wall, Bed spread dirty with cigarette burns in it, pillows had yellow stains when ask for clean pillows and linen staff laughed and said they didn't have any!!  Bathtub chipped and had hard water stains, toilet had dried urine around bottom and didn't flush good. Hairdryer, microwave, and lamp did not work! no ice machine, parking lot dark lights not working, lights in walkway outside of rooms not working. Offered continental breakfast it was a joke!! Toast with butter and bad coffee! We will never stay there again I'd sleep in car first!

name: Brittni Pierce
text: So terrible. Roaches in the rooms, service staff is rude af. NEVER NEVER STAY HERE

name: Cesar Adrian Barrios-Martinez
text: Pretty under maintained and the staff are not knowledgeable about the hotel. Do not recommended to anyone. Unless you're on a budget

name: amy rake
text: There was no hot water at all for showers. Look on door was broken and damage to walls. No lights in our room other than the sink light and bathroom. Doors slamming all night from stairwell because elevator was not working. Rooms were insanely priced.

name: Penny Norris
text: NO WAY-There is simple nothing good to say about this place.Everything was out of order, service was lousy,bugs. Beyond time to close those doors.....Unfit

name: Amanda Porter
text: Was picking up friends that were staying there as guest.

name: Kimberly Bunger
text: The hotel had the wrong name on the building, staff was great. Room was ok, bathroom door would shut or lock

name: Roosevelt Byrd
text: Mold in breakfast area .... rude customer service.

name: David Hilton
text: Nice and quiet

name: J anime
text:
content://media/external/file/1425
Man dis place is shity they didn't wash the sheets the elevators haven't been service the floors are dirty use toilet paper on the rollers chair in the room are flat out filthy I WISH I COULD GIVE IT A QUARTER OF A STAR I WILL NEVER COME AGAIN PLEASE I BEG U GET THIS PLACE SHUT DOWN I HAD TO GO BUY A COMFORTER SET BECAUSE THE SHEETS THEY HAD WERE THAT NASTY!!

name: Kenneth Lewis
text: I pick up a friend for work there

name: David Kilgore
text: Only problem was there was no remote in our room.

name: justin brewer
text: The price was really cheap but the customer service was not friendly.  The pool had to much chemicals in it.

name: gjwilly1 x
text: Poor - staff ok but the place is a disaster!

name: James “SPUDZ” Loiseau
text: Towels was a issue, and our room was but the steps and the door SLAMS and  is extremely loud!

name: Richard Longacre
text: Worst, most disgusting hotel either my wife or I have EVER stayed at. Sadly the pictures must have been taken right after they painted and cleaned. Just don't stay here.

name: Lori Jackson
text: not to far from the beach. basic rooms but clean. Indoor pool

name: Amanda Coburn
text: Going through a remodel...

name: Juanita Brown
text: LOVE it

name: Matthew Brown
text: Lucky their staff is nice and friendly otherwise I wouldn't have bothered with a star in the first place.I only stayed for one night and booked weeks in advanced.When I first showed up everything looked ok at the front office.Clean...yeah sure the breakfast area is small but hell the price was cheep.However despite how calm and friendly their staff is.There was no excuse for the state of the room they first put me in.I will admit I am not the most clean guy myself.But never would I dare bring guests to a room that has Roaches crawling around.Which reminds me I should have let the front staff know about the horrible caulking job they did to try and hide the mold on the bathtub.Not to mention the loose shower head.There was still forgotten items from the previous guest in the room which tells me they didn't give a dam about doing a basic cleanup in the first place.Luckily the second room the put me in was on the other side of the building.Which was MUCH cleaner and well taken care of.They also gave me a $20.00 dollar bill for the "inconvenience" of my stay when I checked out.All an all if anyone was to ask me if I would justify the price for one night.NO I would rather spend the extra $50.00 and go to the first Comfort-Inn at the area instead.

name: Brandon Little
text: I thought they were terrific. Nice rooms, a decent continental breakfast, easy access to the space center, and a swimming pool. Plus, they were very affordable for all that. They have an outdoor pool, but it's in the center courtyard, so it's secluded from the rest of the world.

name: Demeikia Houston
text: Because of the previous reviews i had my mind made up that i was not staying here. but i needed the closest and some what cheapest room to stay in. so i gave it a shot,  i called the front desk and rsvp'd my room i also asked for them to make sure the room was Superior before i got there. the lady was not only polite but had no problem seeing to my needs. once i got there i searched and searched trying to find the littlest thing wrong...but i couldn't. everything was clean and well placed! my stay at this hotel was wonderful and i would recommend it to anyone!

name: Rachel Jordan
text: I loved the place! Everyone was friendly. I had left a few things in the room and they were kind enough to let me retrieve them.

name: Cassandra Spala
text: Horrible customer service! We booked online a week before our trip for a non-smoking king bed room for 2 nights. We drove all the way from chicago to Huntsville Alabama. When we got there, all they had was a king bed smoking room or a non-smoking with 2 double beds. They said sorry, there's nothing we can do.

name: Dwight Hardwick
text: It's a Days Inn now. Very pleasant stay,nice comfortable bed,AC worked really well during this hot 4th of July weekend. Would've given 5 stars but my bathroom was kind of small. But I will be staying again.

name: erika smalley
text: Terrific stay. Had to stay here because I had a house fire. They clean up nice and they have great hospitality.

name: Jason Randolph
text: Has truck parking which is important to me. Flat screen TVs and a recliner in the king rooms. Front desk worker was exceptional. Room was clean and comfortable.

name: Norman Ravis
text: Place is disgusting. Bugs in the room, on the bed, everywhere. Stains all over the carpet, walls, and ceilings. When confronted about the bugs they said "they are just cockroaches, and baby coach roaches, they aren't b.bs" because they didn't want to say bedbugs in front of other customers. That is how disgusting this place is, they have a codename for bed bugs.

name: D'Andre Manigo
text: It was nice. There was an issue with the tub over flowing and some silverfish but ya know.

name: Matt DeBlieck
text:
Pros:
-Nice price
-Nice staff
-Comfy bed
-Decent sized room for price
-Decent continental breakfast

Cons:
-No garbage can
-Mold in shower curtain
-Bathroom floor sticky
-Small bathroom
-Bathroom door and table had small pieces missing/definite signs of damage
-No sign of vending machines (there were soda and ice machines though)
-Key system composed of pieces of plastic with holes punched in them
-Alarm on clock didn't function and clock had persistent interference from Blackberry device
-Suspicious activity from other guests on grounds at night
-No way to close thicker curtains (so no way to not be seen with the lights on
-Cleaning staff leaves lights on in every empty room

Overall:
NOT recommended for families or long stays
If you're looking for an inexpensive place to crash for a night, MAYBE two, then you'll get a decent go at the basics.

name: Jada Snow
text: The rooms are spacious clean Wi-Fi works good and the free breakfast is on point

name: Bryan Young
text: Nice place to stay the night. Plenty of places to eat near by and the hotel was very clean.

name: Albe Manton
text:
La Quinta Inn ‎
3141 University Dr Northwest
Huntsville, AL 35816

Oct 6,7,8,9 2011
Arrived on Thursday for a 4 day stay.  My first room had no cold water in the shower, the faucet was broken.
My second room I found 3 roaches within 15 minutes of being in the room and left right away.
My 3rd room was fine for the first night.
On day 2 The AC would not work.
I called for Maintenance to come fix it. They sent the assistant manager to fix it.
When he could not fix the AC he told me to "tuff it out or check out."
I went down to the front desk were they helped me, and gave me my 4th room in 2 days were the TV did not work.
I requested the Manager call me to discuss my problems, He/She would not contact me after asking every day for three days. The grounds are covered in debris, bottles and beer boxes by the Ice machines and was not pickup in the 4 days I was there. Only one Ice machine worked. They allowed large groups of men(6 to 8) to stand outside on the balcony drinking beer and would not send security.
They allowed a group of young people to have a loud party, with loud music until late at night, and would not send security
Some of the people I was there with checked out and went to another La Quinta about 2 miles down the road.
The rooms are not being maintained and the Management has an attitude that makes it feel like its your fault for complaining. I have been coming to Huntsville for business every year for 4 years and I will not stay here again. There are 2 other La Quintas within 2 miles of here with much better reputation. This hotel does not maintain the standards of any other La Quinta I have ever stayed at. It's not worth staying here just to save $5.00

name: Katie Safford
text: We had our wedding party stay here and it was PERFECT! Rick Was extremely responsive and accommodating. Made our wedding weekend a breeze!

resp.text: Congratulations again Katie! Weddings are wonderful, but also very stressful. We do our best to create a private, relaxing atmosphere for guests to unwind, connect and make memories. It sounds like we succeeded and that makes us so happy. Thanks for sharing your special day with us.

name: Tom Nelson
text: Great stay and play golf house...perfect for foursome. Bigger units available...would be great for non-golfers too. Have thought of almosy everything you need.

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words Tom! We are constantly thinking of how we can make our Oster Golf Houses even better. In fact, when we started our vacation rental business we asked ourselves one question; "If I were to build a house specifically for groups to enjoy, what would I include in that home?" We made a long list and then we built it! The original list included; 4 Master Suites with 8 Queen Beds, large Ensuite Bathrooms with walk-in showers, Huge "Great Room", Brunswick pool table, fully equipped kitchen, putting green outside, screened porch with beautiful views, Big flat screen TV's, square dining tables for 8...and much more!

name: Tom Tom
text: Good

resp.text: Thank you Tom Tom for recognizing us with a stellar rating. Hosting nice people like you is what we do! Each Oster Golf House was designed and built specifically for groups to enjoy.

name: Kysii Ingram
text: Very nice accommodating house. Has alot of luxurious comforts for you and your family and friends

name: Dan Klein
text:
The Palmer House is fantastic!  We had eight golfers for three nights.  The house is roomy.  Never felt crowded in the common areas.  The finishes are really nice.  Great wood floors, crown molding, granite countertops, as well as many other high end touches.

This is just a fantastic set up for a golf trip.  The  bedrooms are like hotel rooms.  The beds are comfortable and the kitchen has everything you need to prepare meals.  I will definitely be coming back to an Oster facility  soon!

name: Rick Ryan
text: Great place.  All you need.  Perfect place for buddies golf trip. Clean, wel equipped

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words, Rick! We were blessed to find a perfect location to build this Oster Golf House, overlooking the 10th hole on the Ridge golf course. You can't stay closer to the clubhouse! Like you said, it's perfect for groups and that's not an accident. We took our time to carefully plan it that way. Everything in the home was designed and built specifically for groups to enjoy: 4 master suites, 8 queen beds, huge "Great Room", fully equipped kitchen, Brunswick pool table, 5 HDTV's, 3 leather sofas...and much more!

name: Leo Merz
text: Great course, but quit cutting the hole on 18 on the false front!!!!

resp.text: Our "Palmer" vacation rental home overlooks the 10th hole of the Ridge golf course, but we don't cut the holes Mr Merz! Leo has stayed with his friends in our Oster Golf Houses on numerous occasions. In fact, they have written great 5 STAR REVIEWS on our website. I hope he takes this comment down because not only is it in the wrong place, the golf courses at Oxmoor Valley deserve 5 stars, not 3! They are fantastic and reasonably priced.

I will most definitely recommend both places as must visits; a stay at any of their eleven properties guarantees a heaping helping of Southern charm and hospitality.

name: Deanna Bourgeois
text: What a beautiful home and location!  The Oster Golf house in Pratville fully met my families needs.  I was impressed with this beautiful home which was located down a peaceful  private drive.  The home was clean and looked just like the pictures.  The fully stocked kitchen was located upstairs in a beautiful entertaining space.  I enjoy cooking breakfast and  looking out the large windows at the golfers and deer in the distance.  In the evening socializing in the area was perfect. We enjoyed playing pool, watching tv, and admiring the view.   This well though-out floor plan worked well for us and we enjoyed every minute of our stay.  In conclusion the home was as described and very conventionally located near shops,  restaurants, and a movie theater.   We hope to visit again.

text: Outstanding. This place has a spiritual quality to it. So peaceful. There are no words to describe the sheer beauty of this place. The owner Michelle is very pleasant to deal with and adds to the overall experience of staying at ossa-win-tha.  Staying here will be a cherished memory of mine, as it was when I was a child. Thank you  Michelle.

name: justin gore
text: This is a very quiet and beautiful place, its got a nice boat ramp for anyone staying here that wants to put there boat in and do some fishing...there aren't very many places like this left around the lake....

name: Sandra Wilson
text:
Nope!
Looking for lakefront for my RV..
Looks like this is where travel trailers go to die!
I do realize it is off season, but seriously so unkept that it would take a serious work crew to level it and start over..
According to Google the office was suppose to be open..lights were on, vehicles in the drive..no one answered..
Dont waste your gas..and the voice mailbox was full..

name: YOLANDA ROSARIO
text: very good.......

name: Amber Maull
text: The room was clean, bed was comfortable, and the staff was friendly. I'm am very pleased with my stay here.

name: Judy Hyman
text: Check in and check out went fine. The room was spacious enough, but had very dim lighting. The bed was comfortable, TV large screen. Would rather a couch instead of chair. Breakfast was made very pleasant for me through Crystal who attended to my needs. I plan on staying again.

name: Ashley Moynihan
text: Our stay was wonderful. Clean room. Pleasant and helpful staff. Good breakfast. Water pressure could have been better. Overall this location provided exactly what we needed.

name: Keith Wyatt
text: I discovered there was no shower curtain.  I requested a shower curtain for my room as I was leaving for work.  I returned 10 hours later to discover I still did not have a shower curtain.  I requested one at the desk.  They handed me one and I had to install it myself.  Dirty towels were removed daily, however they were never replaced with clean ones, I had to go to the desk and get them myself.  I never received additional coffee packets after the first morning of my stay.  I have stayed at this hotel several week per year in this past. I don't know what happened this time.  The staff seemed more interested in playing with their phones than doing their work.  I stay at this location because of it's convenience to my work and restaurants.   There's nothing wrong with the hotel itself just maybe the staff needs a little tune up.

name: Bryce Hudnall
text: Hotel itself is great. Clean room. Large. Great A.C.. Desk staff overnight is not up to snuff. Totally apathetic. Day staff was incredible. Breakfast was pretty good. Great coffee, and wonderful customer service. I'd stay there again.

name: Don Tipton
text: I haven't stayed at a BW in many years. We were travelling from Houston to Atlanta and needed an overnight stop. This hotel was excellent. It was welcoming, the room was clean and updated, and the breakfast was much better than other free breakfasts we have tried. I was very impressed with this hotel and will stay there again.

name: Sheila Corbin
text: Facility, amenities and breakfast was great.  Not clean, poor maid service and 1 front desk clerk was not very helpful.  Our first room reeked of smoke and bed was not made up.  The next room  didn't smell but was not very clean.  Very nice place in need of better employees.

name: Donna Allen
text: The room was clean and roomy. The staff was not friendly. I was asked when I reserved the room if I has any requests. I asked for extra towels. I didn't receive extra. Actually I received 3 towels for 4 guests. I left a not for housekeeping to request extra towels. They replaced the 3 dirty ones with 3 clean ones. I don't think expecting a towel for each guest is a lot to ask for.

name: Thomas Moynihan
text: Low water pressure, but the rooms were clean and well kept. The front desk hostess was kind and helpful. The pantry or small store up front is cash only. Parking decently lit, with a Wal-Mart right across the way.

name: ctr4smflkresandinnov
text: I do not recommend this facility. The room I stayed in looked pretty good on the first glance but when he started to look at the details and it grossed me out. Window curtains that were filthy bathroom that was too small the door almost hit the toilet. And there were stains on the sheets and then there was the noise so when I went to complain about the noise that's when I found out the phone didn't work and in addition the TV didn't work either

name: Angelica Lee
text: Called super late to get prices we were driving in, was quoted 79 +tax, so we booked it. Then got a call saying it was actually 99 + tax. The girl was really nice and it was late so we just went ahead with it. Got there the room looked to have been just made up in a rush but over all very clean (only thing that wasn't was the pull out bed we didn't use though). Room was clean, it was quiet, and front desk was very nice (the 99 price was after giving a discount). I wish we had gotten the original price but it's ok.

name: Tonya Davis
text: My husband and I needed to take break from driving so we spent a night to rest before getting back on the road.  We enjoyed our stay and the staff was very pleasant.  The room was clean. I have never stayed a Best Western and we would stay again.

name: Anthony VanSlambrouck
text: Nice hotel, for what you pay. It's got all the basic needs: hot shower; comfortable room; friendly staff; etc...But the gym equipment is a bit dated and the staff will only accept cash for items out of the hotel shop, (first time ever that I've seen that in a hotel that had one.)

name: Geoffrey Jackson
text: Nice clean well equipped hotel.  Enjoyed the pool. Breakfast range was limited but stay was very enjoyable.

name: Willie Ely
text: I stayed on the 2nd floor, some lady with braids in her head was our house keeper.She was so rude had the worst attitude ever,I had my daughter's with me at the time an they were wondering an looking asking me like why did she have a attitude with us like what did we do wrong besides ask for towels. I HAD to explain to my teenage kids that everyone isn't happy about there jobs an that we did nothing wrong just was upset only because we spent good money for that hotel an only decided to come there cause I read so many good an positive reviews but I guess they were wrong my room #was 210 an the incident happened this morning

name: Lee Murphy
text: Do not stay at this hotel and if you do be sure to check your receipt. I was quoted $84.99 at reservation and when checking out was charged $139.99. They upgraded without my approval and at check in I initial a form and was told I was verifying no pets and no smoking. The price on the form was blank and I verified the price when I checked in. Two calls and was rudely told it is my problem. Front desk personnel are extremely rude and have zero customer care. AND IT SMELLS BAD. Only two towels were provided for a two queen beds room???

name: Jill Peterson
text:
Our stay, generally, was nice. Sheets were clean and it was a quiet room. The breakfast and the wonderful lady who served it was quite good. Her personality made it even better! I believe her name was Miss Wanda.

However, the first thing we noticed when we walked into this hotel was the musty smell. The room had a very sour smell and the bathroom was worse. It was clear that this hotel formally accepted pets. Evidently, the previous residents of this room had had a silly string fight. There was Silly String on the back of the door and on one of the picture frames. I scraped it off picture frame as I didn't think housekeeping would do it as they hadn't done it before ( see attached pictures). Also, it's clear that whoever does the vacuuming doesn't pick up anything and move it. The air conditioner had some kind of occasional chirp that woke us up several times during the night but it was intermittent.
As it is, right now, we would probably not stay here again.

name: Judy Wilson
text: We were very pleased overall with this hotel. Staff was friendly. Room was clean. Breakfast was very good with many choices. Cons: no A/C in halls and breakfast area, which made it uncomfortable (especially in breakfast area).  We also wanted a shower chair for one of our group but they didn't have one available for a non handicapped accessible room. Disappointed but made do without. Suggest they get a couple extra for the future. We liked the extra seating area in the room which they called a suite. The pool was inside yet it was very small. We did not make use of it. We were expecting something much bigger. It was like a large hot tub. Lots of pros and only a few cons.

name: Lee Murphy
text: Do not stay at this hotel and if you do be sure to check your receipt. I was quoted $84.99 at reservation and when checking out was charged $139.99. They upgraded without my approval and at check in I initial a form and was told I was verifying no pets and no smoking. The price on the form was blank and I verified the price when I checked in. Two calls and was rudely told it is my problem. Front desk personnel are extremely rude and have zero customer care. AND IT SMELLS BAD. Only two towels were provided for a two queen beds room???

name: Stephen Courtney
text: Everyone on the staff was very friendly and helpful.  I left my phone charger and the front desk person let me use their phone charger.  It was a great experience.  Thanks.

name: Jon Dodson
text: Pleasantly surprised at how clean, roomy and cost effective this Best Western was. Great customer service from a very kind staff. We will stay here again as we can in our travels.

name: IfYouDontTakeYourVaccine YouCantHaveAnyPudding
text: Shower head was broke and the breakfast was nasty. Couldn't get anyone to check me out the next morning so I just gave up and left. Worst hotel experience I've ever had. Will definitely stay somewhere else next time.

name: KeekeeRocks
text: The location was closed to the highway. There was good food places around it. The room was nice, and so was the breakfast.

name: Jill Peterson
text:
Our stay, generally, was nice. Sheets were clean and it was a quiet room. The breakfast and the wonderful lady who served it was quite good. Her personality made it even better! I believe her name was Miss Wanda.

However, the first thing we noticed when we walked into this hotel was the musty smell. The room had a very sour smell and the bathroom was worse. It was clear that this hotel formally accepted pets. text:
Always a very pleasant stay. The staff is always friendly and helpful, especially Natalie, she always goes  a
bove and beyond to help me. The only issue I had was the drain in the tub, told the person at the desk and that afternoon it was resolved.

name: Terry Herbert
text: For 5he price, you can't ask for much. Only complaint was the lack of service and rudeness from one housekeeping staff named Monica. She treated not only my wife, but other guests with total disrespect. Apparently this is not the first time she has had a complaint. Manager was not present at the time.

name: Blaq Beauty
text: This was one of the beat hotels I ever stayed in. The front desk staff were all so friendlt. The beds are so comfortable you may never want morning to come. They have a FULL breakfast in thr mornings. They are located next to restaurants and some light shopping. If I ever go back to Alabama, i will be staying here again!

name: Brian Zhang
text: Very delicious continental breakfast. Clean rooms, most importantly a quiet ac unit. Very friendly service. Would recommend overall.

name: Charlotte Dyer
text:
Very disappointed! We stayed 7 nights due to business. 1 night we came into the room it had not been cleaned. The other 6 nights it was partly cleaned. Maybe once they left us a full set of towels. There was black mold growing behind the toilet which got bigger while we were there! We moved the chair to watch tv. And there was a spot on the carpet about the size of a dinner plate.. We have no idea what that was but it was growing!  The plate in the microwave was the wrong one and would not turn. The maid left her cleaning spray in our room.. Maybe that was for me to do my own cleaning. We always walked the stairs, they were filthy( same trash, spills for several nights) We needed to extend our stay however, it wasn't going to be there!
We are in this area often and have stayed here before, with similar problem. But this is getting bad! We were only in the room to shower and sleep. I started coughing shortly after I would get in and when I woke up I felt like I was sick with allergies. We have given them many chances. This was the last one.
I didn't mean to give them one star, I couldn't get it to go away! 😏 July 17, 2016

name: cindy henderson
text: It was very clean. Comfortable beds. Good breakfast. Great location.

name: mary webster
text: Overall, the hotel was very clean and the staff was excellent.  I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel.

name: Jo James
text: Do not recommend this place at all. Had to move from one room to another because of fowl odor. Another guest complaining of same. Staff was ok but entire place lacked cleanliness

name: minnesota rabit
text: Book online if you want to receive their posted discounts, AARP and AAA not honored at desk. Find out info you need on check in such as internet passwords, and if you did not bring toiletries, get them then as room not stocked. Hotel is clean and offers breakfast, rooms are good.

name: Richard Pierre
text: We stayed for 3 nights during Hurricane Irma. We found our room clean, room service was careful and prompt. The Manger Marsha was helpful in our stay. My son's used the pool 2 separate times and there is a Walmart Supercenter close by with gas. We had to escape Hurricane Irma.

name: 55schone
text: This hotel was horrible.  The front desk person didn't know what he was doing and couldn't figure out how to change rooms.  Then he put us in a smoking room when we had non-smoking and the whole floor smelled of smoke so bad you couldn't breath.  The front desk person the next day was very rude and when I ask to speak to supervisor they hung up on me .  I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

name: Ruth Scott
text: Everything was clean and neat. The staff was friendly. Good variety of food at breakfast.

name: Teri DeFoe
text: Older hotel, but nicely kept up. The room was comfortable. The price was great for a one night stay.

name: Mary McCollum
text: everything except the breakfast was great....the breakfast could use some work...the BEDS were FANTASTIC best sleep anywhere outside of home

name: Belinda Nation
text: The people were friendly, my room was great. BW in Saraland was very convenient to the city of Mobile.

name: Richard Johnson
text: Stayed at this BW multiple times. The price is reasonable, but has started a downward trend of lack of cleaniless, broken AC, Bathroom Vent, and occasional bugs. If you are on a tight budget it would be worth the stay.

name: Richard Pierre
text: We stayed for 3 nights during Hurricane Irma. We found our room clean, room service was careful and prompt. The Manger Marsha was helpful in our stay. My son's used the pool 2 separate times and there is a Walmart Supercenter close by with gas. We had to escape Hurricane Irma.

Even manager Moneisha stated she watched the tape of the employee Bridgett offering to clean up which never happened.  $91.19 for a nasty room and nasty attitude from manager.

text: This may be an unfair rating because this hotel was chosen for me by work. This is a 3 day max room that I'm in for 2 weeks. Housekeeping does great so far, hotel is clean and doesn't look to be run down at all. The parking lot isn't very big.

name: Koriya Padgett
text: The hotel was very comfortable - the halls were hot and we chose the 4th floor smoking in error.  Ugh - Great for an overnight stay.

name: Bobby Stover
text: Excellent amenities, comfortable bed clean room and grounds. Highly recommend this location.

name: Matt Smith
text: Very impressed Best Western was not normally a place I would stay but they have improved a lot.

name: Mark Strudwick
text: Okay I guess... Hotel was clean but laundry was not that great with old machines that were kinda falling apart. Breakfast was okay. They do not allow pizza deliveries to the rooms and the convenience store is cash only, you can't charge items to your room. Overall, underwhelming

name: LaKayla Diamond
text: When we got there the room we reserved had people in there..  What's worse,  the staff didn't even know it... We walked in to a room full of junk and people... Very disappointed

name: Willie Wilson
text: great people over all keep up great job

name: Tony Padgett
text: The a/c on fourth floor was non existent In the hallway.. also somehow we got a room that was a smoking room.. I hate cigarette smoke. Other than that, right off the highway, plenty places to eat and a Walmart within walking distance.

name: S Rogers
text: The room was nice but service could have been better. Desk staff was unfriendly and the manager was non-chalant. I stayed 2 nights and no one ever came to offer new towels. I couldn't get an answer at the front desk so has to go downstairs and personally ask for towels. There was also a number of unattended minors being very loud roaming the halls and rough playing in the pool area (still unattended). There seemed to be no concern about that until they became so noticably disruptive that one of them pulled the fire alarm and the police were called. Breakfast was good the first day but unfortunately we were unable to enjoy breakfast on check out day bc for some reason they stopped serving breakfast before the scheduled time.

name: Bruce Bohlin
text: Very clean friendly staff good breakfast great southern hospitality

name: anna whittington
text: 4th rm before getting a decent rm. 5:30 A.m. fire alarm goes off- breakfast burning- took forever to get cut off!! Bagels hard. No air in breakfast rm!! I'm not usually a complainer, but this sucked!!

name: Your friendly neighborhood purple dinosaur
text: Very friendly, easy to get there and near Mobile. Bed is comfortable and clean.

name: Susie Powell
text: I only gave it a 3 star because the room was clean and smelled great but the ac was broke and it was hot in the room. And nothing done about it. 82$ down the drain. Guess I should have read the reviews.

name: terrance griffin
text: Really nice property. Beautiful rooms and overall decor.

name: Jacqui N
text:
After sitting in a traffic jam at practically a standstill for over an hour; after listening to my 6 month old scream and cry for over 2 hours, I was ready to get a room for my 2 & 1/2 year old, 6 month old, and our dog. I was at my wits end, but I made a reservation online using my phone with the understanding that Best Westerns were famously pet friendly.

Upon arrival, it took the lady over 3 minutes to even come to the counter, at which point someone else had joined me in line. She wanted to wait on the other patron first, COMPLETELY ignoring me and my 6 month old in my arms. He told her to get me before him.

We started going through the normal motions of checking in when I asked if the hotel were pet friendly. She NASTILY replied they weren't. ( Take in to account I've been on the road since 7 am and my mind wasn't working anymore with the cacophony in my vehicle ). So I asked if she had any idea who did. Again a nasty reply: 'You can try the MICROtel.'

Seriously? Ya know, I wouldn't have minded being told they weren't pet friendly. It was her BAD ATTITUDE that set me off. I was IN TEARS pulling out of there. And yes, as soon as I put my 6 month old back in the car seat, he started screaming again. I'll think twice about staying at a Best Western after this experience. You'll get No compassion at all from them.

name: Mackenzi Tomlinson
text: This hotel is very nice.they your rooms clean and have great service

name: Sherry Jamison
text: Nice room at a decent price

name: Khris L
text:
My family and I stayed there in February 2010 during MardiGras.
The hotel was very nice, loved the decor in the rooms. The staff on the other hand was pathetic. My husband took our daughter downstairs on his shoulders to see the pool, a few minutes after they left Ruby at the front desk called my room and told me that guest were complaing and to please tell my child to stop running. She wasn't even in the room. So when I went down stairs to ask her what the deal was she told me that she had just seen my husband and daughter. No apology for the false accusations. That night we were in the room and the kids above us were running and making so much noise I couldn't hear the TV. I called the front desk 3 times and nothing was done.  A few days later I talked to the "manager" I don't think she had a clue what she was doing. There was no apology from anyone except one girl that I talked to at the front desk. She is the only one that seemed to care about the crap we had to put up with that night. There were people on the top floor partying all night. It was very noisy. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

text: One of the better motels in Montgomery, very clean, NO BED BUGS! NO ROACHES! I'm a very picky and extremely clean individual so this was very important to me when we moved into this motel. They have done some amazing renovations and there is security on site..if you need a ride to your job they will shuttle you to and from work for a very small fee...the staff is all extremely kind and understanding. They will definitely work with you if you are having financial struggles! It's also pet friendly! I can't imagine why anyone would give this place a bad review, I enjoy living here! ❤️

When I would report it, they would always have an excuse. These people are definitely "CAREER CRIMINALS."

resp.text:
Thankyou for your feedback.
Upon checking we see that the hotel  was kind enough because you had been here for two(2) months to let you stay a week without payment because your money was delayed, unfortunately you decided to leave without paying and without  personal items that you left in the room.
Maintenance does have the right to remove items that have been abandoned.
If you wish to get items before they are disposed of please make payment at front desk.

We are doing our best to always provide a pleasant guest experience.

text: It was not my room

name: brinkley Brinkley
text:
They've done alot with lighting outside but front desk needs customer service skills..
Also changes their policy or rules day to day...Keeps customer property. Be careful with vehicles and motorcycles you park in parking lot.

resp.text: Brinkley, thank you for the feedback. Sorry that you feel that we improperly "keep customer property", but on that issue, the guest had checked out of the hotel, but left his motorcycle on property, we could have had it towed after a few days, but stored it away for over a month, guest paid us and thanked us for storing-he had been locked up for unpaid tickets.

name: Eddie Horne
text:
During Hurricane Irma, I was unable to return to Florida due to the extensive damage.  I got a room for the going rate of $45.00.  Little did I know that I would be pleased with the room and the friendly service.  I was expecting a lower status room; however, to my surprise the room had all the amenities like a refrigerator, phone, flat screen tv with the remote,  a comfortable bed, and plenty of clean towels in the restroom.

What I expected was a third world hotel but I found an very livable suited place to comfortably rest my head in my times of trouble.  I was paying $85 per night just 3 miles away.  I am happy with this hotel, the money I am saving, and the friendly staff that occupies the facility.

My mother came by at one point with my children to bring me some groceries and Mona got mad and said I had to many people in the room. They were just dropping off groceries. I was accused of stealing from them and when they found the tools they accused me of stealing in the owner Jay's van never once did I get an apology and in the end they ended up ruining the relationship between me and my wife and I've lost her due to everything that took place because of them. text: I can not give this place any stars because that's how terrible the stay was.  First off when we arrived to check in there were about 4 or 5 guys in the parking just hanging out, only to find out that they were in the room next to us. Coming from Detroit it looked kind of suspicious, like may be they were selling drugs or something. The room itself was not the best. There were burn marks on the bedspread and the night stand. There was also a strange odor. We stayed because it was cheap and they had already charged my card for 2 nights. The ice machine was broke and look like something out of a horror film. We stayed 2 days without the room being cleaned or any garbage bags or tissue so we bought our own. I called the front desk to get a noon check out and was rudely told NO by a white guy posing as the manager. So we left at 11 and by 1:00 my card was charged an additional $50 for a cleaning fee. First of all when do hotels start charging for a free service. The room was already a smoking room so there is no charge for that. We stayed 2 days and did not have the thrash changed or given any bags for thrash. I threw all of my garbage in the thrash can and tried to straighten the room up as best as I could but after Mr Manager rudely told me to get out I did not clean the room since you have a housekeeping department for that. I WILL NEVER stay in this hotel again.

text: I'm staying here for two days on business and I've never experienced a hotel this bad before. Just now I called the service desk from my cellphone because the room phone doesn't work and I needed a toilet plunger for the toilet. The receptionist caught an attitude when I asked her if she had a plunger. I'm only here because my job paid for my stay, I'll be telling my company to never book here again for any other field agents. Worst hotel experience I've ever had. Do yourselves a favor, trust the stars and reviews, they really mean something.
