name: L WH
text: My family and I were traveling from Texas to Virginia and booked 2 rooms on Friday July 25, 2015. I have stayed in many hotels and motels for work as well as when traveling and this was THE worst overnight accommodations I have ever stayed in. One room smelled so strongly of mold that is was almost unbearable. The carpet was so gross I wouldn't let anyone take their shoes or socks off! The other room had black mold and a ceiling that was falling in. The rooms were not inexpensive so it was the worst money I ever spent! Never will stay at a Choice Hotel again!

name: Shantel M
text: Wishing I could give this place 0 stars. I will upload photos to yelp. Absolutely disgusting with black mold in the shower, lights out and cigarette burns on the sheets.

name: Gordon Burnett
text: Bed bugs and one of the worst rooms I've ever seen.  Asked for a refund and was told they couldn't give a refund. I was in the room 3 min at the most. It smelt like mold, pulled the sheets back and watched two bugs walk away.  I wouldn't recommend to anyone to stay at this dump.  It doesn't deserve one star at al

name: Felix Diaz
text: Is good for The Price but sometimes no work Good the microwave or the refrigerator

name: carla abney
text: Thanks to mlucio we were able to get some much needed sleep. She was sooooo friendly and professional.  Thx again mlucio

name: David Todd Hunter
text: Overpriced, not clean, horrible service

name: Jennifer Williams
text:
I visited your location on Friday July 10, 2015. Along with my husband, brother, sister in law and their son.
We check in about 1 am.
We are not from the area we had to come in on an emergency trip. My mother had a major heart attached. ( She was there helping her mother after her mother had heart surgery 2 weeks ago.)
So by the time we traveled as we did and spent all of the time at the hospital with my mother we wanted to sleep.
We arrived at your location checked in and went to the room. When I first walked in I notice that the ashtray was filled with cigarette butts, walked to the bathroom and seen that there was urine on the floor by the commode, then I got to looking and notice that the shower was very nasty the ceiling looked as it was fixing to fall, the shower rod was barley hanging on, and a piece of duct tape just stuck to the wall. Also notice that there was hair on the towel. Very unhappy at this point I thought let me look at the bed, the first bed was dirty, it had hair and spots all over the sheets the 2nd bed it had food on the sheets and brown spots.
At this point I had enough was so upset. I had dropped my keys behind the chest and had to move it and surprise again a powder substance with a straw.
I am NO longer upset I am MAD.
I went down to the lobby and told the desk clerk what I was dealing with. She let me know she did not have any more rooms I ask for more sheets and towels, just so that I could lay down for a few hours to be back at hospital with my mom. She said hold on walked around the corner and walked back said she did not have any and there was "NOTHING SHE COULD DO FOR ME". Really!!!!!!!
So because we had all of our items unpacked already I decided that I would just run to the nearest Walmart purchase sheets and blankets. Just so that we can get some sleep.
We did not even take showers due to not having clean towels.
So I was putting the sheets and things on the bed and SURPRISE AGAIN the matters had a very big whole in it and then I was beside my self.

name: C. Suarez
text: The staff is always very attentive.

name: Steve Nix
text: If I could have given this a lower rating and still posted I would have. Hands down tje dirtiest, nastiest place I have ever stayed in. We had to evacuate because of hurricane Matthew and this was the closest place we could find after 10 hours on the road. They raised the price to 125$ a night and never made anything better. Called us today that they are only refunding half after being told that we would receive a full refund. Sleep in your vehicle before staying here because that's what I will do if it ever came down to it again.

name: Jarvis Giles
text: Great rooms better price

name: Blake Gillis
text: Right off the interstate i10 for saraland. My room was on the bottom floor. Rooms are outside the building. Are not pet friendly

name: Terrelle Tillman
text: Disgusting hotel.. dirty bedding, uncovered lighting in bathroom, pet hair in the carpet, burn holes in covers, as well as dirty covers. Old dusty furniture.

name: Matt Martinez
text: we paid then went to the room and immediately walked out it was disgusting stained chair smelled of smoke really bad broken dresser the bed was sunk in in the middle went down.and requested another room bit it was the same story I think this place is a drug hotel there was trash everywhere in and around the parking lot and trashcan overflowing on to the walkway we got a refund and left to a nicer hotel December 2015

name: Bryan Thornton
text: Friendly staff really nice

name: Ja`Darrius Causey
text: It was great place to stay at

name: Kelly Marie
text: sucks

name: Felton Leffall
text: Just plain Nice

name: Happiness On Purpose
text: Wonderful time with my sweetheart

name: Pat Tardo
text: The room smell  and the AC had mildew in it . I left out didn't go any farther. I ask for a refund.

name: Toney Mcwilliams
text: OK thanks

name: Jack Jones
text: Tv half worked bed uncomfortable rate rose $50 because of hurricane Matthew.

name: john Thompson
text: Not clean enough in the rooms.

name: Fancie 1982
text: I came here after a great trip, and was going home, I was getting sleepy so I stopped here, it was crap.

name: Devante Solomon
text: It was very dirty and their staff wasn't trained well.

name: Jason Kiefer
text: Tv didn't work. No fan in bathroom. Light in bathroom takes over a minute to come on. Toilet ran all night. Least the heater worked.

name: Ridge Berry (Chuck)
text: A few things weren't clean in my room,  and the sink wasn't working

name: Edgar landa
text:
(Translated by Google) Ehh

(Original)
Ehh

name: Erin Johnson
text: We stayed in the cabin for a night and it was perfect. Love the farm! The animals are amazing, the scenery is beautiful. We're already planning our next trip down to Alabama and we want to stay on the farm again

name: big country
text: The owner was more than helpful and beyond nice. The place is off the beaten path and is absolutely amazing

name: Takara Hein
text: Wonderful night in the camper. Loved sitting and watching the lightening bugs at night and enjoying the company of the chickens and Duece while drinking our morning coffee. So peaceful and much needed escape from the city.

name: Michael MacChesney
text: What an amazing place to spend a night or too.  Cabin was rustic, but clean and part of the charm.  Great fo kids to feed animals.

name: Peter Long
text:
Very tranquil, and relaxing.
The animals love attention!
Recommend for those looking to relax and reflect.

name: Maggie Meadows
text: Great place to stay if you want something quiet and off the beaten track. Jerod is a great host and the farm is one of my favorite places to stay in the country. Dog friendly too!

name: oliver brown (ollie)
text: nice, quiet, and serene. great place to relax

name: Austin Chaffin
text: Stayed here for a a couple of days every year. Great place to stop on cross country road trips.

name: Kei Bottoms
text:
Great view, older cabin BUT nice enough. To fully enjoy your stay...
- Bring your towels. 3 of us stayed, only one set of towels was provided.
(We asked for more, but they never brought us any...that's why 4 stars - wish there was 4.5 stars)
- Bring all of your hygiene products with you. They provide 1 soap. We brought everything, so it caused no inconvenience.
- Bring your coffee. They only leave enough pods for one cup/day.

We visit during my husband's AFTP weekend. Love that we can take our dogs. Can't wait to go back and enjoy the lake beach in the summer :)

name: Amber Danley
text: Beautiful area, clean and well kept. Wonderful weekend spent with my husband and children. Looking forward to returning.

name: jeri Hunter
text:
WE HAD THE BEST TIME EVER!!! 💖💖
THANK U FOR THE BEAUTIFUL CABINS, LAKE and SCENERY. ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

name: brianqb
text: We stay away these cabins to visit friends. Between our two visits the insides are starting to show their wear. The staff is helpful but it's obvious they are on a tight budget. Kids enjoy the lake and playground, and the lake setting is nice, updated furniture and kitchen would go a long way.

name: Brenda Mark
text: Nice accommodations, roomy screened in porch.  Great for family. Clean, a couple cabins allowed pets had to be charged extra for them.  I would recommend!

name: T 6
text: Very nice and relaxing layout!! Great room and loving space!! Small Shower but Excellent Air Condition and Cieling Fans👍🏽

name: Jabe Fincher
text: We didn't stay at the cabins but the lake is wonderful and a great view.

name: Pier Curry
text: I "ABSOLUTELY LOVE" this place!! This was my family's 3rd stay and I will be returning!!

name: Jose Cantres
text: Though I only had a one night stay the cabin was great. At this time of the year it was quiet and uncrowded. The view to the lake was unobstructed, with a fantastic morning sunrise. The rooms were big with plenty of closet and drawer space. Kitchen was also adequate with some cups and plates available, and a roind dining table. The living room was spacoius. Bathroom was the reason for the 4 star rating, though functional, it was a bit small. Because of the one day stsy, I can't say if there is a daily turn down service ir not. Overall I will recommend it, and would stay there again. Hopefully for a longer stay.

name: Krystal Gragg
text: Some frustrating lack of service, but the view and accommodations cannot be beat near Rucker, and a fantastic price.

name: AL Hesse
text: Great place to stay!

name: Jessica Menasco
text: Beautiful

name: Lawrence Murison
text: Had hreat time

name: jesse larson
text: Horrible housekeepers if you can even call them that. They steal from you and do a crappy job cleaning your room. Also they have a Roach problem the only somewhat good thing is the bar connected to the building, but its not worth it STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE you'll be much better off

name: carolyn P
text: Great place to stay when visiting Birmingham. The staff was wonderful. I originally had a reservation at a hotel down the street, but their handicap accessible room was not even close. I went to the Holiday Inn and explained my situation. The manager let me see the handicap accessible room they had available to make sure it fit my needs. Will definitely stay here the next time I'm in Birmingham.

name: Allen Skinner
text:
Overall a nice Holiday Inn and well worth staying.

Pros:  Freshly renovated. Friendly staff. Rooms well furnished. Bonus for work travelers with easily accessible plugs and USB charging adapters.

Cons:  The place was short staffed so check in was a bit longer than average.  Breakfast is not inclusive so more costly than comparable lodging that include breakfast with the room rate. Thus the 4 star rating.

name: Ben Myers
text: Very nice location. Excellent staff. Hotel seemed very new, bed was comfortable, bathroom was clean. Great place to stay. I would definitely recommend it!

name: Rhonda Vinson
text: The staff is great! They're kind, personable and accommodating.  The hotel is clean and well managed. We stayed 3 weekends in a row and will definitely be back.

name: Jeffrey Reardon
text:
It's now a Double Tree by Hilton
Beautiful place. Great staff. Great location! A must stay if you're in Birmingham, AL

name: Jill Reidelberger
text: Stayed here last night...we are from Nashville TN.  This place was great.  From check in to check out they were attentive to our every need.  Very friendly staff.  Mike was awesome!!   Thanks so much.

name: Raj Patel
text: The gentleman at the front desk who checked me in was outstanding! Great customer service and professional. I would stay here again.

name: Joe LaFerriere
text:
Spent the night here and was extremely impressed. According to the desk clerk this was a renovated property…and they did an excellent job. The room, overall property, and service was top-notch and I would definitely stay here again. Rivals some of the "higher class" properties I stay at!

My ONLY complaint…if you are going to serve good coffee at the coffee bar…include some half-half/cream for coffee please. Dumping those chalky, disgusting creamers into a good cup of coffee really ruins the money you paid for it.

name: Mist One
text: This location was a little further outside of downtown than I anticipated. I'm not familiar with the area, so I would have preferred to be in town a bit more. There's nothing to eat after 10pm, which was a problem the night I arrived. Room was clean, bed was comfortable and the parking was free.

name: Shira Mardis
text: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here! Nice location, clean and modern style rooms and an excellent staff. Carlos remembered me from previous travels and was personable, polite and courteous. I highly recommend this hotel!

name: les haynes
text: Dropped off bags and returned to room ,discovered it was a handicap suite. Hotel was booked ,nothing was available. After several attempts, the manager wasn't  available.  I was assured the check in clerk informed us it was a handicap suite. ...we were moved to the suite we reserved following morning. The manager was "off property " at checkout. ..  The staff use the handicap parking places.   Nice property, if there is an issue you out of luck. Management isn't available.

name: Florence Stewart
text: I went to this hotel for a free dinner and work shop about Diabetes.  It as hosted by Dr Jason J. Koenig D.C.  We were served a nice dinner by very professional hotel staff.  The atmosphere was most elegant and comfortable.  I would certainly consider this venue if I needed to entertain a large group like for a wedding or a reunion..

name: Steven Jung
text: Wow, one of the best Holiday Inn Express I've stayed at. Staff was awesome! We got in late and the gentleman that was cleaning the floors was kind enough to open the mini bar and serve us some beer. Absolutely top notch service! As always clean rooms, great AC units, plenty of hot water, and up to date decor. Breakfast was a little high at $10 bucks, but it was an all you can eat buffet. Food was OK. Overall a very nice stay. Dont hesitate to stay here if you travel though AL.

name: Brink Shinn
text: We landed here while traveling and if I’m ever in the area again, I’ll make sure this where I stay.  There was a young gentlemen there, at the front desk named Carlo.  He should be commended and promoted with how much he helped my family with our stay.  His service was top notch and treated us as if it were his hotel.  Management should be very proud he is on staff.

name: John White RCDD
text:
I’ve seen worse - decent in a pinch if you just need sleep etc. very slow internet ( 4 MBs ) and you pay for breakfast. A soda is 4 $ and my bed has blood stains on it. The staff should wash their outfits and present themselves more professionally. Who manages this place ?
The staff are nice for the most part - this is a management ( or lack of ) issue. Best thing about my stay ? A really nice older gentleman running the store in the evening.
So , this is an accurate review honest. This place has so much potential ! Why the owners don’t take advantage of that is beyond me.

name: jacqueline misera
text: Go all the way in the back for this treat. A little hard to find. But our class reunion birthday bash was in this nice place. There is tons of shopping centers across and down the street. Some in walking distance and any store you can think of. Upscale area.

name: Christopher626
text:
Facilities were really good.
The problems:
1)  I booked a room at a rate of $107 and was charged $157 at the front desk (taxes and fees don't you know).
2) I'm a Holiday Inn "Rewards" member - still trying to figure out the benefits.  All I wanted was some water after a very long day of driving.  I finally show up at the hotel - no water at check-in, no water in the room...   I go downstairs and was charged $15 for four waters - not really feeling "rewarded."
3) Paid $23 for breakfast for two.  A cappuccino would be "extra."  Trying to squeeze every last dollar out of us...
The more I think about it, the less happy I am about having stayed gere and the less I want to recommend it.  Again, the facilities are Great but for the money (and the gouging), I'd highly recommend staying somewhere else.

name: Mike Hunt
text: Very nice, clean Hotel, with good amenities. My only complaint is the incomprehensible hidden location off the main road? Does make for a fairly quiet night though!

name: jacqueline misera
text: Go all the way in the back for this treat. A little hard to find. But our class reunion birthday bash was in this nice place. There is tons of shopping centers across and down the street. Some in walking distance and any store you can think of. Upscale area.

name: Debbie Finlayson (Deb)
text:
NICE  ROOMS!
Our room was so nice and big and clean! The beds and pillows were very comfortable and the Linens and bath towels were plush! Thank you Tatiyanna Clark at the front desk for going above and beyond all that you did to help me and my family! Not only were you helpful but you did it with a heart felt smile. Thank you Miss Joy also. I would have given a 5 stars except the room had an unpleasant odor, it is probably just the AC air filter needing changed.

name: Ray Suggs
text: Very clean, modern facility. Indoor pool was great. Need earlier access to the pool especially when traveling with small children.

name: Jeff Werner
text: Great place to rest up when traveling. Friendly staff, modern up to date hotel with many food options in the area.

name: Terhea Stinson
text: Had a great time. Rooms were very clean and they had everything we needed. The staff was very nice and friendly.

name: tonya Harville
text: In house restaurant, indoor pool, gym, and patio area, were all very nice. The king size bed was nice and cozy.

name: Je Davis
text: Staff was nice but there are not enough parking spaces and bathroom was not as clean as it should've been

name: Ricardo Ago
text: The room I stayed in was very clean.  The lobby, even with construction going on, was still kept clean.

name: Aaron White
text: This place is great.  It has a wonderful workout facility, pantry and restaurant.  The showers are wonderful and the beds are comfortable.  There was a Reno done in 16.   Great TV's too!

name: crystal english
text: Only stayed one night but they have a nice outside area but not a 🚬 area. Breakfast was 😋.nice comfortable beds. Air condition was kind of loud but tolerable. The good definitely out weighted the bad.

name: SMines623@gmail.com Mines
text: AS OF NOW THE DESK CLERK SEEMS TO BE NICE, ROOM NEAT AND CLEAN COULD USE A LITTLE TIDY UP THE BATHROOM BUT I GUESS THEY JUST DON'T SPECIFY CLEAN THE WHOLE TOILET SO HOUSEKEEPING HALF CLEAN THE ROOMS. IT DOESN'T DO ANY GOOD TO COMPLAIN CAUSE THEY COME UP WITH AN EXCUSE....

name: Sandra Stamps
text: The service was awesome from the time I checked in to the moment I left. My room was very nice and very clean l was there for 3 nights and 2 nights I went out to eat dinner my least night I had dinner in the bar the food was delicious I wish I had eaten there ever night. The cook should get a raise. Thank you too everyone for making my stay wonderful.

name: Barb Cunningham
text: Horrible place. We stayed at this hotel on our return trip from Florida. We were told that there was a restaurant on site and we were also told that there would be free breakfast the next morning. Since we were traveling with 2 small children, my sister and I thought that would be a positive aspect. Once we were checked in, we went in to the restaurant. We should have turned around and went to another place when we saw that it was completely empty and the server was leaning against the bar looking at his phone, but unfortunately we didn’t. Long story short, it took an hour to get our food (two kids meals sliders and two quesadillas). When we did get it, my granddaughter’s slidders were burnt. Next morning we went to get our free breakfast, but were told it was going to cost $10.95 per person. Be smart, just say no to this hotel. The staff were rude and lazy!

name: Mary Pete
text: Checked in Aug. 20 2019. The front desk receptionist I think the name tag said Lantray had an immediate look of “I don’t want to be bothered today”. With an down right ugly attitude, but the other lady Louise was very kind. The Food was amazing, lobby looked newly renovated, and it looks like there will be more renovations. Elevator and rooms need a little more attention, not that I would stay here agian, I just expected more!

name: Laura Mildenberger
text: Clean, quiet, updated, close to great restaurants. They have a nice outside seating area, too. Would definitely recommend.

name: Frank Peavy
text: This place is awesome. The mattress definitely needs to be flipped. Other than that it is totally first class air conditioning system works great people are great also friendly people.

name: Eric Hicks
text: Camilla at the breakfast bar, hopefully I spelled her name correctly, gave me the best customer service I have ever had at a hotel this morning. She was very nice and friendly even though I showed up very close to their closing time. She even took it a step further and recommend something good off the breakfast menu for me to try. Thanks to her again for the great service.

name: Lala Giving
text: I stay at this hotel as I was passing through to Gulf Shores. As I pulled in I noticed the parking lot was full of vehicles and the lobby had maybe 5 people in front of me. There was only one employee at the desk normally front desk staff are rude or mean but Corey handled us all very well, polite and professional despite the fact that he was continually interrupted by the phone ringing and ringing. As I approached the counter he greeted me respectfully and apologized about the delay. One of the 4 people  who entered behind me begun to get impatient by me having to try three different cards but Corey stated that each of us are important and as he was answering phones and checking us in he gave me his full attention. This place has wonderful customer service but they can definitely use an extra person at the desk on busy nights. The overall stay exceeds my expectations. The rooms were very clean. Each time I called down for any towels toothpaste and the TV guide the staff were really attentive. I enjoyed dinner and breakfast the restaurant staff are great. Great place to be for travel if you want to feel at home. By far the most updated holiday inn I stayed in a long time. The location is very convenient for families. They have an indoor heated swimming pool that I enjoyed as well. Will definitely make this my go to place next time I’m passing through!

name: Brother Smitty
text: We liked our stay. The night staff was so helpful i believe his name was Cameron.

name: David Clark
text: Great hotel. It's easy to get in and out of and there is lots to do within walking distance.

name: David D. Scott
text:
Hotel in very close (like in the plaza) with a variety of places to eat and drink... So If I got overboard it's an easy walk..
Also my room is perfect and very clean. The staff are friendly as well. I'll be working at my company's Birmingham office from time to time and this is where I'll stay!

name: Scott Johnson
text: Very nice stay. Restaurant and bar and breakfast on site, liked the rooms paint color

name: Amber Marshall
text: Looks renovated. Hotel was pretty good. Towels and washcloths seemed to have several stains on them. Our room was missing an iron. Overall good hotel and convenient area.

name: J. Appe
text: The hotel was very nice. I really liked the styling of the entire hotel, especially the rooms. I do have to say that the check in person left something to be desired though. He was very unorganized and I was tired and had to use the restroom so that was slightly annoying to have the check in process take so long. Then on top of it I get all the way to my room only to find out he didn't set up my keys so I had to go all the way back to the front desk to get those set up. Other then that the hotel was great.

name: Steve Moss
text: We have stayed here several times. It has undergone a management change since our first stay and the difference is night and day. The staff is beyond helpful. Special thanks to Amy that got us a awesome room at a great rate. We stay here when coming to visit our son at Samford and the way we've been treated we wouldn't stay anywhere else.

name: E Mullins
text: Rooms were clean and well stocked, staff was nice and professional. Would definitely book this hotel again.

name: She Wee
text: From the friendly staff to the truly amazing breakfast this hotel was great. Newly renovated with plush comfy beds. I will stay here every night I am in Birmingham.

name: Stacy Keith
text: JUST DON'T STAY HERE...Im a big review person but it was late when we booked this hotel so didn't read reviews first but unlike many holiday inn this does not have complementary breakfast and the breakfast is expensive for what u get just go to McDonald's across the road their is nothing about this hotel different from all the rest holiday inns customers service was horrible there computer system was down and she really didnt try to make it a easy checkin it was complicated to her she wrote our card information down gave us a room at the far back of hotel on 2nd floor we went to room it was tiny and has a mold smell she called us 10 mins later telling us our card is declined we walk all the way back to front and she says our card is no good she had wrote it down wrong and then we watched her call it in again on her cell phone and input our card info in 2 more times in wrong and kept getting declined because her nails was so long i told her i will do it because she going to lock down our account  she keeps doing it wrong and we complained about small smelly room and she told us we get the room we got.I can keep complaining but just go another 10 mins away and stay at another 1 we stayed at several in this area over this past week as we had family in hospital and all where way better then this for same price with complimentary breakfast and better customer service and rooms.

name: Roy Parker
text: Nice hotel with large rooms and comfy beds. I was only there for a night. I had no issues other than the ac making a squeaky noise.

name: Chef TréJ
text: Joy was an incredible! She was patient, helped us, kept a smile on her face, friendly to every guest that came by, and very patient! We got the suite in 501. It was clean, beautiful, and comfortable.

name: Brandon Cowart
text: Good place. Nice room. Joy at bv the front desk is an absolute joy (lol) and a perfect example of what excellent customer service looks like

name: Kim Dupree
text: Beautiful hotel, friendly attendants, great location! Cheap laundry facilities, too! I definitely look forward to staying here again.

name: Lynn Tingle
text: The dinner wasn't as good as you would expect in our Meeting.  The chicken was dry and tough.  The tea tasted like it was served from a strong flavor coffee pot.

name: Mikey Mike
text: MAGA great service and hospitality. Nice clean rooms and A warm staff at the reception area and restraunt. The only reason it wasnt 5 stars is they had A trash problem on the TV in the main lobby. CNN is fake news and anyone who shows this garbage to the public wont ever have my business again.

name: Hayley T
text: Beautiful updated Holiday Inn. We loved the modern look. Room was very comfortable and clean. Bed was great. Check-in was fast. Would come back for sure when in the area.

name: Craig Cleveland
text: It wasn't bad as far as Holiday Inns go. Air conditioning in the main lobby and dining area was a little weak. Swimming pool was closed the first day. The staff in large part was very nice and accommodating.

name: Lakeinnya Gales
text: My friends and I stayed there about 2weeks ago.My room was very nice and clean.The front desk staff was very helpful and nice Shannon and Joy.The Breakfast was Awesome and Nikisha made my morning..She  went over and beyond for my mother who is disabled and the cook me.Curtis was super friendly also.Great Job You guys keep up the awesome customer service.Cause of people like them we will definitely be coming back..

name: Luke Otfinowski
text: A very nice stay at a Holiday Inn property that meets and at times exceeds the expectations of the brand. The open, lounging restaurant area is particularly enjoyable and unique.

name: Chad Karnes
text: Very clean, we'll maintained, excellent staff! It's in a great area of Birmingham with plenty of restaurants and Walmart and Sam's Club if you need anything. I highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

name: Rachel Keeler
text: The room was spacious and clean. The staff that I encountered was a bit abrupt, and the room was missing the standard toiletries(shampoo & conditioner). Otherwise, it was a fine hotel.

name: Tom Austin
text: Beautiful rooms. Nice staff. I wish they had smart TV so I could watch my Netflix.

name: Nonaral Goldsmith
text: This hotel that is full service is o e of the worse hotels we've stayed in. The rooms are terribly cleaned, dust everywhere and I doubt if they vacuum the floors at all. I noticed a member of the staff staying in a room. Staff members smoking on the job, I passed an employee she smelled of marijuana and she was cleaning the rooms or inspecting them. How can you do your job and high early in the morning.  I see why the rooms look terrible. Fair warning pick another hotel or be very watchful of your surroundings.

name: Amanda Gomez
text: Very pretty decor, clean, super friendly and polite staff. My bed and pillow are so comfy. They have a very good breakfast too.

name: brianna jackson
text: Very clean and nice staff

name: Lekenya Williams
text: Bed bugs!!! Newly renovated rooms, beautiful decor and bed bugs. I felt something crawling on me so I check the bed and find a bed bug under my  pillow. We had to get a refund and find another hotel. Very disappointed and we will not be staying there again.

name: Bradley Gill
text: People here are so friendly and helpful. It was one of our better stays at the Holiday Inn's. And we've stayed at several.

name: Lauren von Thaden
text: Great experience! Hotel looks brand new, very clean! Great breakfast buffet and friendly staff.

name: Collin and Alicia Smerk
text: The new look of the lobby and conference room areas is great. My room was very large and well laid out for working during my stay. Very clean environment and helpful and pleasant staff.

name: Scott Ellman
text: Check in was easy and quick. Room was updated, bed very comfortable. Good nights sleep.

name: Chris Kimble
text: Nice staff, but room wasn't cleaned when we first entered it, had to immediately go to pool and wait... the pool was, well, I couldn't see my knees in the water - it was that murky

name: Nancy Wentzel
text: If you like 10 kids and 6 'adults' running in the halls, doing cartwheels, screaming, laughing and partying outside of your door while you're trying to sleep- then this is the place for you! Called the front desk 6 times to complain. Utter disgrace! And breakfast is usually complimentary at hotels...not here! $10 bucks a person. Please take my advice and spend your hard-earned money someplace else. Definitely not worth $150+ a night.

name: Ryan Bowers
text: Beautiful modern hotel with all features you'd expect nowadays (USB charging ports!) Very quiet and enjoyable. Would definitely stay here again.

name: David McDonough
text: Hotel itself was very nice. Rooms are large and clean. ONE warning: be sure to ask if breakfast is included before booking. We thought it was and found out otherwise.

name: Will Harris
text: Ladies at the front desk had poor attitude was ignored for 45 seconds before they were done conversating with one another at check in my questions were answered in a rude manner which made me feel unwelcome. Rooms are great, clean facilities, good food. Need positive front desk staff.

name: Erick Griffin
text:
Utilized this hotel for a week while on business travel.
Very nice, clean, and quiet.
Several restaurant / fast food options close by.

name: Timothy Smith
text: This is the most worse hotel experience I've ever had. Check in clerks were rude and one young lady smelled awful. The manager did not assist as though she seen these young ladies dragging their feet. I am a spire Elite member and will never stay here again. When the assistant manager came to the front desk he had no knowledge of the check in procedure. My bed had bed bugs and no toilet tissue when I arrived. Housekeeping did not service my room the next day and the restaurant was out of each choice I selected. Employees were out back smoking marijuana lady and guy in a gold SUV. This place need new management and employees.

name: SOLO DOLO
text:
I’ve stayed at a lot of hotels for business travel and this will be the only hotel I stay at while I’m in the area.
I’m upset I didn’t choose this location for my previous travels to this area. Staff is great! I lOVE  how the staff made me comfortable with my stay. The hotel breakfast was ok. BUT the hotel DINNER was fantastic! We were served by Chief Ashanti, very kind woman. The food was very presentable, the kids and I loved it. We had tacos, flavored Wings, spinach dip and pub fries. The servers were extremely kind. A guy name Mike helped me around the hotel and with some minor storm issues I came across. There was not one single individual I crossed that gave me any bad impressions. Great job guys!!!

As you can see I enjoyed my stay and I can’t say that about a lot places.

If you’re in the area, check it out!

One thing that could be fixed is the hot water. It takes about 20 mins to get hot. They should fix that. And the POOL was always Unavailable

text: I booked a room after working late and arrived at the Hotel only to find out they gave my room away!! The guy at the front desk told me it's first come first serve but I always thought that was for people WITHOUT RESERVATIONS!!! So I basically had to sit in the parking lot to find another place to stay so I could try to get a little rest before going back to work the next day (I am a business traveler). I will NEVER stay at this location again and from this experience, I'm SERIOUSLY considering using the Hilton chain from now on. I travel too much to have to worry about this happening again and I never had this experience with Hilton. I wish I could give a negative rating because I would rate this location a negative 5!!!

Also the site says there is a bar and grill on-site another lie and false advertising, all my reasonings for booking this hotel were lies.

name: Coray S
text: Camp Chula Vista is amazing! The directors and counselors are full of God's spirit and love. The camp really works hard to pour that spirit and love into everyone. The daily structure of activities and games gives everyone something to look forward to. Friendships grow stronger, as kids work together through the week. That same friendship lasts through the year, as kids look forward to seeing each other again. You can't find a better place to be with God, than at this church camp.

text: Such a beautiful place to disconnect from the world and recharge. The new beds sleep great at their hotel. They have so much to offer here. Canoeing, hiking, biking, sometimes even horses. A beautiful lake

name: Mel Bass
text: Camp Chula Vista has offered amazing experiences for my children for many years while they have grown up attending the summer camps.  My oldest daughter had her wedding rehearsal in the CRC and we used the hotel rooms for our guests.  The staff is amazing and I couldn't say enough good things about this camp. It was very clean and orderly.  The rehearsal meal was catered by Camp Chula Vista and was simply delicious.  My children always come home talking about the wonderful food that is served at the summer camps.  God is always the focus at Camp Chula Vista and continues to bless it.

resp.text: Thanks for your review.  We are glad your family continues to come enjoy God's beautiful view at Camp Chula Vista.

name: Elizabeth Armstrong
text: The cabins at Lake Tholocco were great! The rooms are nice provide lots of drawer space for your items. The cabin is pretty big for how little they charge. You get two rooms, a bathroom, living space, little dinning area, full size kitchen, and an awesome outdoor patio area that is fully screened. We loved sitting in the outdoor area, just relaxing. You don’t have to worry about the bugs and it felt nice and cool. These are cabins not a high end hotel so it does look older, and have that cabin feel. The only things that I’d say wasn’t great would be the shower, and the lack of kitchen supplies they provide. The shower is pretty narrow so it can difficult to shower. The kitchen only has the bare necessities, and nothing more lol. If you have family near by make sure to ask them for a blender, extra cooking spoons, pizza pan, extra pots and pans, larger knifes, food storage container, and mixing bowls, measuring spoons and cups. They also only provide two Keurig coffee containers then charge if you want more, so make sure to buy some at the store to get more for your buck. Overall it was a great place to stay and we loved having all the space unlike a hotel room. Would definitely recommend!
